title: Fix logging: add file rotation, API call tracking, remove payload leaks
description:
## Problem

Logging has several gaps:

1. **No file handler or rotation** — both entry points (CLI, MCP server) use `basicConfig(stream=sys.stderr)` only. No `FileHandler`, no `RotatingFileHandler`, no size limits.
2. **No timestamps** — format is `"%(levelname)s: %(message)s"` with no timestamp or module name.
3. **Paid API calls not logged at info** — the actual synthesis API calls (Polly `synthesize_speech`, ElevenLabs `text_to_speech.convert`, OpenAI `audio.speech.create`) are not logged. Only `"Wrote %s"` after file I/O is at info.
4. **Payload leak** — Polly logs `text=%r` at debug level (`polly.py:214`). Should not log request text at any level.
5. **No structured/consistent format** — no module name in format, no `dictConfig`.

## Fix

- Add `RotatingFileHandler` with size limit and backup count, configured via `logging.config.dictConfig()`.
- Add timestamps and module name to log format.
- Log each paid API call at `info` level: provider name, voice, character count (not text content).
- Remove `text=%r` from Polly debug log.
- Keep stderr handler for CLI (verbose mode) and MCP server.

## Files

- `src/langlearn_tts/cli.py` — `_configure_logging()`
- `src/langlearn_tts/server.py` — top-level `basicConfig`
- `src/langlearn_tts/providers/polly.py` — synthesize() logging
- `src/langlearn_tts/providers/openai.py` — synthesize() logging
- `src/langlearn_tts/providers/elevenlabs.py` — synthesize() logging

title: Language-first TTS: make language a first-class concept
description: The system is language-blind. Users must specify voices directly, and the default is always English regardless of text language. Language should be the primary parameter alongside text; voice should be an optional override. Enables: auto-select voice per language, voice-language mismatch validation (Polly), filtered voice suggestions in errors, explicit language modeling in pairs. ISO 639-1 codes as the interface. Backwards compatible — existing --voice usage still works.

title: Add HTTP/SSE transport for remote and daemon deployment
description: The server currently only runs as a stdio subprocess managed by the MCP client. Add HTTP/SSE transport so the server can run as a standalone daemon process. This is required for ChatGPT desktop (remote-only MCP) and enables shared/hosted deployments, running on a different machine than the client, and any future MCP client that requires remote servers. FastMCP supports mcp.run(transport='sse') already. Scope: --transport flag on server entry point, host/port configuration, documentation for remote setup across clients. Consider auth/security implications for network-exposed endpoints.

title: Suppress pydub SyntaxWarning on Python 3.13
description: pydub 0.25.1 emits SyntaxWarning for invalid escape sequences in utils.py (lines 300, 301, 310, 314) on Python 3.13. These warnings print to stderr before doctor output, making CLI output look broken. Upstream issue — pydub uses unescaped parentheses in regex strings. Fix options: (1) add warnings.filterwarnings in CLI/server entry points, (2) pin pydub to a fixed version if/when released, (3) contribute upstream fix.
